meanings.definition: The act of stealing or robbing.
meanings.sent1: The blaggings in the neighborhood caused fear among the residents.
meanings.sent2: The police were investigating a string of blaggings that occurred last week.
meanings.sent3: The blaggings at the candy store were so frequent, they started locking up the lollipops.
meanings.sent4: His blaggings of hearts left a trail of broken relationships behind him.
meanings.sent5: The blaggings of jewels from the museum were executed with precision and stealth.

meanings.definition: A series of thefts or robberies.
meanings.sent1: The blaggings in the city were escalating, causing concern among the authorities.
meanings.sent2: The news reported a wave of blaggings targeting local businesses.
meanings.sent3: The blaggings of garden gnomes from the front yards amused the whole neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The blaggings of sunlight through the trees created a mesmerizing pattern on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The blaggings of rare books from the library left shelves empty and minds hungry for knowledge.
